sample.title: DES Complementation Property
sample.summary: Shows the complementation property of the DES cipher
sample.description: The complementation property of DES means that the work for a brute-force attack could be reduced by a factor of 2 (or a single bit) under a chosen-plaintext assumption. By definition, this property also applies also to 3DES cipher. The template demonstrates the property.
sample.title: DES Komplement-Eigenschaft
sample.description: Durch die Komplement-Eigenschaft lässt sich mit einem Chosen-Plaintext-Angriff bei einer vollständigen Schlüsselsuche der Suchraum des DES auf 2^55 Schlüssel halbieren. Diese Vorlage zeigt diese Eigenschaft des DES.

replacement.value: By comparing C and C' XOR 111... you can see that DES indeed has a "complementation property".

This template demonstrates the "complementation property" of the DES encryption algorithm.\line\line "Complementation property" means that DES fullfills the following equation:\line\line DES(P,k) = C <=> DES(P',k') = C'\line where P is the plaintext\line k is the key\line C is the ciphertext\line and P', k', C' are the "bitwise complements" of the plaintext, the key, and the ciphertext.\line Example k='110011000..." => k'='001100111...\line\line The complementation property means that the work for a brute force attack could be reduced by a factor of 2 (or a single bit) under a chosen-plaintext assumption (source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard#Security_and_cryptanalysis).\line\line Thus, the complexity for a chosen-plaintext attack is 2^55.
P (a single 64 bit block for DES)
111... a 64 bit block with 111... for XOR
By comparing C and C' XOR 111... you can see that DES indeed has a "complementation property".
